Heart Opening

(unpublished/private draft for purposes of expanding kykeon documentation)

Sunday, July 11 2021
·
6 min read

A heart opening can be defined as the experience of the function of one or more specific receptor sets or “mental organs” coming into the forefront of a person’s subjective perception, through the use of psychoactive compounds. The intensity of this experience is proportional to the extent at which the mental organs associated receptor sets are being modulated, ranging from subtle in their presence to overwhelming and impossible to ignore.

Depending on the mental organ which is being manifested into consciousness, a variety of differing arrays of subjective effects may present themselves. These are listed and described in a comprehensive level of detail below.

5-HT1

serotonin 1A receptor

-

HYPOTHESIZED FUNCTION

“Language, logic, reason, concepts, thought, patterns in nature”

POTENTIALLY ASSOCIATED SUBJECTIVE EFFECTS

analysis enhancement, analysis suppression, language enhancement, language suppression, thought organization, thought disorganization, thought connectivity…?

β

beta-adrenergic receptor

-

HYPOTHESIZED FUNCTION

“Home, family, community, society, humanity, joy”

POTENTIALLY ASSOCIATED SUBJECTIVE EFFECTS

empathy, affection, and sociability enhancement, introspection (of a specifically interpersonal nature), cognitive euphoria, increased sense of humor…?

H1

Histamine H1 receptor

-

HYPOTHESIZED FUNCTION

“Empathy; dynamic, persistent, and cumulative theory of mind”

POTENTIALLY ASSOCIATED SUBJECTIVE EFFECTS

empathy, affection, and sociability enhancement, introspection (of a specifically interpersonal nature)...?

α2

alpha-2 adrenergic receptor

-

HYPOTHESIZED FUNCTION

“Sense of the essence or soul of things (rasa), or events shaping one’s self”

POTENTIALLY ASSOCIATED SUBJECTIVE EFFECTS

conceptual thinking, personal bias suppression, ego death, existential self realization…?

α1

alpha-1 adrenergic receptor

-

HYPOTHESIZED FUNCTION

"Sense of continuity, history, flow of events"

POTENTIALLY ASSOCIATED SUBJECTIVE EFFECTS

time dilation, time compression, a-temporality, perception of eternalism, time reversal, memory suppression, introspection (of a specifically retrospective nature)...?

D

dopamine receptor

-

HYPOTHESIZED FUNCTION

“Meaning, significance, awe, and certainty; integration”

POTENTIALLY ASSOCIATED SUBJECTIVE EFFECTS

novelty enhancement, personal meaning enhancement, conceptual thinking, personal bias suppression…?

I

imidazoline receptor

-

HYPOTHESIZED FUNCTION

“Ecstasy, empathy, openness, compassion, peace, acceptance, forgiveness, healing, oneness, caring; letting go of anger, grudge, guilt, shame, anxiety; ability to safely experience and contemplate mental pain”

POTENTIALLY ASSOCIATED SUBJECTIVE EFFECTS

emotional euphoria, physical euphoria, emotion enhancement, empathy, affection, and sociability enhancement, catharsis, introspection, anxiety suppression, unity and interconnectedness, mindfulness, depression reduction, addiction reduction…?

μ

μ-opioid receptor

-

HYPOTHESIZED FUNCTION

“Comfort, security, peace, gentleness; dissipation of pain, hunger, tension, anxiety, frustration, fear, anger and aggression; Edenic”

POTENTIALLY ASSOCIATED SUBJECTIVE EFFECTS

anxiety suppression, physical euphoria, pain reduction, appetite suppression, emotional euphoria, muscle relaxation…?
